name: Shroud
description: The Shroud is a Medium-sized undead creature, characterized by its ability to move stealthily and strike from the shadows.
memorable: Its capacity to drain the strength of its victims and potentially rise from the corpses of non-evil humanoids adds an unsettling layer to its already menacing presence.
goals: Primarily seeks to weaken living foes and grow more powerful through life-draining attacks.
relations: Can be encountered alongside other undead or dark creatures, and may serve as a scout or harbinger of greater evil.
environment: Often found in dark areas such as crypts, abandoned buildings, or shadowy forests.
strengths: Strong stealth abilities and the potential to evolve into a more dangerous form, the shadow.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to radiant damage and significantly impaired in sunlight.
attacks: Utilizes a Strength Drain attack that deals necrotic damage and imposes disadvantage on the target's Strength-based weapon attacks.
most_powerful_ability: Shadow Evolution allows it to transform into a shadow after dealing substantial necrotic damage to a non-undead foe.
senses: Has darkvision up to 60 feet, allowing it to see in darkness as if it were dim light.
skills: Proficient in Stealth, making it adept at avoiding detection.
additional_information: Immunity to necrotic and poison damage.
Can move through narrow spaces without squeezing.
Does not require air, food, or sleep.
Can rise from the dead if it kills a non-evil humanoid.
Imposes disadvantage on its rolls if in sunlight.
test_queries: stealthy undead creature that drains strength
undead that turns foes into more of its kind
dark mobile monster vulnerable to radiant damage
creature that becomes a shadow when it attacks
